summary:
The Atlantic Ocean is the second-largest ocean, covering 17% of Earth's surface. It separates the Americas from Afro-Eurasia. A video taken from the International Space Station shows a pass over the ocean from Newfoundland to central Africa.

Humans first crossed the Atlantic during the Age of Discovery. Christopher Columbus' journey in 1492 led to European exploration and colonization of the Americas. The ocean has been crucial for trade, colonization, and global connections, though it has also seen slave trade and naval battles. Today, it remains a vital trade route.
title: Atlantic Ocean
